member.name: T:ArcGIS.Desktop.Internal.Editing.ElevationSurfaces
member.summary:
Provides a portal into the Elevation Surface native code.
Queries for elevation are not awaitable because we want them to run within the Global Utility ThreadPool and not block any of the Dispatcher or CIM threads unnecessarily. The calling/thread pattern is typically like this: UI --> managed(QuerySurfaceMapPoint) --> Dispatcher --> native(CIM) --> native(Global TP) --> native(CIM) --> managed(QueryService/Sync) --> QueryCache callback
The CIM really only gets involved when Geometrys are de/serialized

member.name: M:ArcGIS.Desktop.Internal.Editing.ElevationSurfaces.QueryMapSurfaces(ArcGIS.Desktop.Mapping.Map)
member.summary: obtains a list of surface definitions for the given map

member.name: M:ArcGIS.Desktop.Internal.Editing.ElevationSurfaces.QuerySurfaceMapPoint(ArcGIS.Desktop.Mapping.Map,System.String,System.Double,System.Double,System.Threading.CancellationToken)
member.summary: Starts an elevation surface query which may take considerable time. The x and y values refer to a point in Map SpatialReference. Z will eventually be returned in the Map SR.
member.returns: a task that eventually returns true == the query successfully started in a background thread, or false == some error occurred and query did not start
member.param: the map containing the surface to be queried
the ID of the map surface to be queried
the x ordinate of the query point, assumed in the map's spatial reference
the y ordinate of the query point, assumed in the map's spatial reference
can be used to cancel a running query

member.name: M:ArcGIS.Desktop.Internal.Editing.ElevationSurfaces.QuerySurfaceGeometry(ArcGIS.Desktop.Mapping.Map,System.String,ArcGIS.Core.Geometry.Geometry,System.Boolean)
member.summary:
Starts an elevation surface query for the given map, surface ID and input geometry.
If the query starts in a background thread, then the return is true, and when it completes, the callback will be invoked with the result, otherwise the return is false, and the callback will not be invoked.
member.param: true == only existing NaNs will be updated, false == all values will be updated
member.returns: a task that wraps either true == the query successfully started in a background thread, or false == some error occurred and query did not start

member.name: T:ArcGIS.Desktop.Internal.Editing.MapTool.MapTool
member.summary: Represents a tool command used to perform interactive operations on a .

remarks.para: This base class can be used to create tools to interactively identify and select features in the view or to create custom construction and editing tools. It provides virtual methods that can be overridden to perform actions when keyboard and mouse events occur in the map view, such as and . When overriding mouse and keyboard virtual methods if you need to execute any asynchronous code first set the handled property on the event arguments to true, override the corresponding "Handle...Async" method, and add your asynchronous code.

By setting the property to true, the tool will create a sketch in the map view with a left mouse click. Use the property to set the geometry type of the sketch and use the property to specify whether the sketch geometry is in screen or map coordinates. Override to add behavior to the tool when the sketch is finished.

code.title: Custom Identify
code.description: Create a tool that allows you to sketch in the view and return the features that intersect the sketch.

code.title: Get Map Coordinates
code.description: Create a tool that allows you to click in the view and return the point in map coordinates that was clicked.

If you close the dock pane the tool will be deactivated and if you activate a different tool the dock pane will close. You can get a reference to the Embeddable Control using the property.

member.name: P:ArcGIS.Desktop.Internal.Editing.MapTool.MapTool.UseSelection
member.summary:
Gets or sets if the sketch needs a selection in order to operate. This requirement allows the tool to have two different modes; the normal sketch mode and an additional selection mode.The user is able to toggle the tool between sketch and select modes by pressing and holding down the SHIFT key. When this occurs the sketch is suspended and the user can select additional features. Releasing the SHIFT key puts the tool back into sketch mode, restores the previous state of the sketch (and the sketch undo / redo stack) and allows you to resume sketching.
The default value is false.
member.remarks:
Your SketchType must be SketchGeometryType.Point, SketchGeometryType.Multipoint, SketchGeometryType.Line or SketchGeometryType.Polygon in order to be able to toggle between sketch and sketch selection modes. No other SketchTypes support this behavior.
When this property is set to true, the user can enter toggle betewen sketch and selection mode by holding the SHIFT key. The sketch state is saved while the SHIFT key is down and selections are made. The sketch is resumed when the SHIFT key is released.
If this property is set to false, the MapTool does not recognize the SHIFT key as having this special behavior.
Note that toggling between selection and sketch modes can also be achieved with the method. If using this method, the sketch state will only be saved if UseSelection is True.

member.name: M:ArcGIS.Desktop.Internal.Editing.MapTool.MapTool.AddOverlayAsync(ArcGIS.Core.Geometry.Geometry,ArcGIS.Core.CIM.CIMSymbolReference,System.Double)
member.summary: Add an overlay graphic to the map view.
member.remarks: When the tool is deactivated all overlay graphics will be removed.
member.param: The geometry of the overlay.
The symbol to use for the overlay.
Map reference scale or -1
member.remarks: When the referenceScale is not equal to -1, the overlay will be created in real world units relative to the provided map reference scale (referenceScale). Otherwise, the overlay will be created in units of points. This is only supported in 2D.
member.returns: An object that when disposed will remove the overlay.

member.name: M:ArcGIS.Desktop.Internal.Editing.MapTool.MapTool.AddOverlayAsync(ArcGIS.Core.Geometry.Geometry,ArcGIS.Core.CIM.CIMSymbolReference,System.Double,System.Double)
member.summary: Add an overlay graphic to the map view.
member.remarks: When the tool is deactivated all overlay graphics will be removed.
member.param: The geometry of the overlay.
The symbol to use for the overlay.
Map reference scale or -1

Visibility factor for showing the overlay through other objects when obscured in 3D.
Valid range is [0..1], any other value will be treated as 0 (not visible).
member.remarks: When the referenceScale is not equal to -1, the overlay will be created in real world units relative to the provided map reference scale (referenceScale). Otherwise, the overlay will be created in units of points. This is only supported in 2D.
member.returns: An object that when disposed will remove the overlay.

member.name: P:ArcGIS.Desktop.Internal.Editing.SketchTool.VerticesRequiredToFinish

member.name: F:ArcGIS.Desktop.Internal.Editing.SketchTool._toolReactivationWorkaround
member.summary: Turning this on will prevent the sketch tool's context from being cleared on the next time the tool is deactivated and then reactivated. This is necessary because when a map is opened, code in ViewerPaneViewModel will deactivate the active tool and then reactivate (to work around a layout issue) To keep the current tool context from being lost, we need to ignore that the tool was deactivated/reactivated and keep the original context around longer.

Default value is false meaning that the tab will display information for the active row. Override this property if you wish your tab to work with the set of selected rows.

member.name: T:ArcGIS.Desktop.Internal.Editing.ErrorInspector.ErrorInspectorToolbarSettings
member.summary:
Base class to handle toolbar settings. Settings are saved when an error source is deactivated (toolbar is hidden) and restored when an error source is reactivated (ie the toolbar reappears) This base class handles two basic settings - IsMapExtentFilterOn, IsExceptionsFilterOn. The expectation is that your toolbar (if your error source requires one) will display controls allowing the user access to modifiy these settings. Each toolbar has a single settings instance and it should be created in the constructor of your toolbar.
Inherit from this class if necessary to add your own settings relevant to your toolbar controls.

member.summary: Name and image are currently displayed in the error Inspector Source dropdown

member.name: P:ArcGIS.Desktop.Internal.Editing.ErrorInspector.InspectorError.AllRowsContextMenuID
member.summary: Context menu to appear when a row is right clicked in the row indicator in the error inspector when table is in 'ShowAllRecords' mode. Default context menu is "esri_editing_errorInspectorRowContextMenu". Set this property in your constructor if you want a different context menu to appear (or no row context menu).

member.name: P:ArcGIS.Desktop.Internal.Editing.ErrorInspector.InspectorError.SelectedRowsContextMenuID
member.summary: Contet menu to appear when a row is right clicked in the row indicator in the error inspector when table is in 'ShowSelectedRecords' mode. Default context menu is "esri_editing_errorInspectorRowContextMenu". Set this property in your constructor if you want a different context menu to appear (or no row context menu).

member.name: P:ArcGIS.Desktop.Internal.Editing.ErrorInspector.InspectorError.ShortcutTableID
member.summary: Shortcut table for error source. By default no shortcut table is set. Set this property in your constructor if you want a shortcut table. See esri_editing_shortcutList_topologySource_errorInspector for an example.

member.name: P:ArcGIS.Desktop.Internal.Editing.ErrorInspector.InspectorError.BurgerButtonMenuID
member.summary: Context menu for burger button. By default no burger button is visible. Set this property in your constructor if you want a burger button. See esri_editing_burgerMenu_topologySource_errorInspector for an example

member.name: F:ArcGIS.Desktop.Internal.Editing.ErrorInspector.InspectorError._columnWidthsByFieldName
member.summary: Allows overriding of the default column widths by tableControl. Add to this collection in your constructor if you want to increase (or decrease) a column width

member.name: F:ArcGIS.Desktop.Internal.Editing.ErrorInspector.InspectorError._orderedFields
member.summary: List of fields in the order they are to be displayed. Passed to the tableControl. Set this ONLY if you want to override the default order of your error source table fields. Specify the fields you want to order. All other fields will be listed in the order they are defined in the table.

member.name: F:ArcGIS.Desktop.Internal.Editing.ErrorInspector.InspectorError._hiddenFields
member.summary: list of fields initially hidden on the main inspector table. Passed to the tableControl. By default all fields in your error source table are displayed. Add to this collection in your constructor if you wish to hide fields (objectID for example). Use ActiveTableControlVM.UpdateFieldVisibility to add/remove from this collection at runtime (via a burger button for example)

member.name: F:ArcGIS.Desktop.Internal.Editing.ErrorInspector.InspectorError._filterFields
member.summary: List of fields which will be can be used for filtering in the the main inspector table. Add to this collection in your constructor if you wish to be able to filter by these fields (shapeType for example). Any fields in this collection will use the default filtering mechanism.

member.name: P:ArcGIS.Desktop.Internal.Editing.ErrorInspector.InspectorError.HasExceptionFilter
member.summary: Does the error source contain an exception filter? This might be part of the FilterFields or it could be implemented by the error source in a different way (like the InspectorTopologyError). Override this property if your error source provides an ExceptionFilter.

member.name: F:ArcGIS.Desktop.Internal.Editing.ErrorInspector.InspectorError._resourceKeysByFieldName
member.summary: List of resources (value converters) used to customize column display in the error inspector grid. By default no customization of fields is performed. Add to this collection in your constructor if you wish to customize field display. For example, the topology error source translates the TopoRuleType from an integer to a string with the rule description

member.name: M:ArcGIS.Desktop.Internal.Editing.ErrorInspector.InspectorError.AddResourceKey(System.String,System.Windows.ResourceKey,ArcGIS.Desktop.Internal.Core.TableCellBindingTarget)
member.summary: Add a resource key. Binds to the table cell's value by default, but optionally can bind to the entire table row if you need additional field values.

member.name: F:ArcGIS.Desktop.Internal.Editing.ErrorInspector.InspectorError._detailsTabResourceKeys
member.summary: List of resources (value converters) used to customize column display in the Details tab. Add to this collection in your constructor if you wish to customize field display. For example, the topology error source translates the TopoRuleType from an integer to a string with the rule description

member.name: F:ArcGIS.Desktop.Internal.Editing.ErrorInspector.InspectorError._tabs
member.summary: List of tabs ids to be displayed on the RHS of the error inspector (preview, details, fix etc). Ids need to be registered with esri_editing_ErrorInspector_Tabs. Add to this collection in your constructor if you wish to display information tabs. Note that at least 1 information tab is required.

member.summary: Shape field names of error source

member.summary: ShapeLength field names of error source. Note that if you only have point errors then LengthShapeFieldNames will be empty

member.name: F:ArcGIS.Desktop.Internal.Editing.ErrorInspector.InspectorError._areaShapeFieldNames
member.summary: AreaShape field names of error source Note that if you only have point errors then AreaShapeFieldNames will be empty

member.name: M:ArcGIS.Desktop.Internal.Editing.ErrorInspector.InspectorError.GetShapeFieldNames
member.summary: Determines the shape, shapeLength, shapeArea fields for your error source. Override this function if you need to determine these fields from something other than the ErrorMapMember. Call this function in your constructor.

member.name: P:ArcGIS.Desktop.Internal.Editing.ErrorInspector.InspectorError.CanToggleEditorTrackingFields
member.summary: Indicates if the error source allows the editor tracking fields to be displayed. By default these fields (if they exist) are hidden and cannot be displayed. Override this property in conjunction with making the esri_editing_errorInspectorToggleEditorTracking button available on a menu or toolbar to allow the user to toggle the editor tracking fields

member.name: M:ArcGIS.Desktop.Internal.Editing.ErrorInspector.InspectorError.OnSourceActivate
member.summary: Opportunity for you to perform some action when your error source object is chosen in the dropdown and activated. For example, when a topology source is chosen it updates the topology source dropdown on the EDIT tab to match.

member.name: M:ArcGIS.Desktop.Internal.Editing.ErrorInspector.InspectorError.OnSourceDeactivate
member.summary: Opportunity for you to perform some action when your error source object is de-activated in the source dropdown.

member.name: M:ArcGIS.Desktop.Internal.Editing.ErrorInspector.InspectorError.SubscribeToEvents
member.summary: Opportunity for you to subscribe to events. This method is called when your source is activated or the error inspector is made visible with your error source current.

member.name: M:ArcGIS.Desktop.Internal.Editing.ErrorInspector.InspectorError.UnSubscribeFromEvents
member.summary: Un-subscribe from events subscribed to in SubscribeToEvents. This method is called when your source is deactivated or the error inspector hides or is closed.

member.name: M:ArcGIS.Desktop.Internal.Editing.ErrorInspector.InspectorError.GetRowData(System.Int64)
member.summary: Retrieve the row data for your error source for a particular oid. This routine is called every time the activeRow changes. Override this method if you need specific information from your table row for other functions such as GetErrorFeature. Create a class inheriting from ErrorInspectorRowData and return this populated appropriately. For example, the active row information for a topology error can be found in the TopoInspectorRowData class.

member.name: M:ArcGIS.Desktop.Internal.Editing.ErrorInspector.InspectorError.GetErrorFeature(ArcGIS.Desktop.Internal.Editing.ErrorInspector.ErrorInspectorRowData)
member.summary: Returns the MapMember and oid of the error feature. Override this if your implementation of ErrorInspectorRowData has additional or different error information. For example, topology errors contain a virtual oid linked to the topology composite layer (since it is a combination of the point, line and polygon error tables). The TopoInspectorRowData object (inherits from InspectorRowData) contains additional information which holds the real oid relative to the appropriate error sub layer (point, line, polygon error). The topology implementation overrides this method to return the real error oid and layer rather than the virtual oid with the composite layer.

member.name: M:ArcGIS.Desktop.Internal.Editing.ErrorInspector.InspectorError.GetErrorFeatures(System.Int64[])
member.summary: Returns a dictionary of layers and oids for the set of specified oids. Override this implementation if your ErrorMapMember does not contain the true error features. For example, in the topology implementation the ErrorMapMember is a topology composite layer. The error features are contained in the topology sub layers (point, line, polygon errors).

member.name: M:ArcGIS.Desktop.Internal.Editing.ErrorInspector.InspectorError.GetSourceFeaturesForErrors(System.Int64[])
member.summary: Returns a dictionary of layers and oids which contributed to the set of errors specified in the set of oids. This default implementation returns an empty dictionary Override this method if you can determine the source features. In the topology implementation this returns the set of features which are feature1 and feature2 displayed in the inspector table.

member.name: F:ArcGIS.Desktop.Internal.Editing.ErrorInspector.InspectorError._hiddenDetailsFields
member.summary: The list of hidden fields on the details tab.

member.name: M:ArcGIS.Desktop.Internal.Editing.ErrorInspector.InspectorError.SetupHiddenDetailFields
member.summary: Set up the list of hidden fields on the details tab.

member.name: M:ArcGIS.Desktop.Internal.Editing.ErrorInspector.InspectorError.GetDetailsDataForField(ArcGIS.Desktop.Editing.TableGridRow,ArcGIS.Desktop.Editing.TablePaneField,System.Collections.Generic.List{ArcGIS.Desktop.Editing.TablePaneField})
member.summary:
Determine if the field specified should be displayed in the Details tab. The visibility of the field in this tab may be independent of the field's visibility in the inspector table. In addition provides the ability to change the display data value of the field from the raw value (similar to a value converter). Override this function if the visibility or display value of the field is to be different.
For example, topology errors always show the shape area and length fields in the Details view regardless of geometryType and whether the columns are displayed in the inspector table.

member.name: M:ArcGIS.Desktop.Internal.Editing.ErrorInspector.InspectorError.GetRefreshStateOnEditCompleted(ArcGIS.Desktop.Editing.Events.EditCompletedEventArgs)
member.summary:
Called within OnEditCompleted event. Determines if rows in the table need to be refreshed. If a refresh is required, also determine if the activeRow is to be retained This default implementation uses the following logic refresh is required if features are created, deleted or modified in the ErrorMapMember active row is retained if features are modified in the ErrorMapMember
Tuple values to be returned are item1 - is a refresh of the table rows required item2 - is the activeRow to be retained

member.name: M:ArcGIS.Desktop.Internal.Editing.TableControlCoreViewModel.RefreshTable
member.summary:
Refreshes the table properties. Thin Wrapper on the RefreshTableProperties.
Logic: - Exit if already refreshing. - (_isRefreshingTable) - Set _isRefreshingTable to true. - Set _resetTableOnRefresh to true. - Calls RefreshTableProperties with true.
Class Variable used - _isRefreshingTable - Used to prevent recursion. - _resetTableOnRefresh - Used to reset the table of refresh.
Early Exits Already refreshing, (RefreshTableProperties)
member.returns: Awaitable Task.

member.name: M:ArcGIS.Desktop.Internal.Editing.TableControlCoreViewModel.ResetRows(System.Int32,System.Boolean,System.Boolean)
member.summary: Set the _activeRowObject = null, but does not fire Notify property changed event. - Clear the _savedRow and _loadSavedRow. - Reset the current row object. - Fires collection change events. - The internal row update uses the dispatcher and the event is not awaitable.
member.param: If resetActiveRowCol is true: Clears the ActiveField, while keeping the current _activeFieldIndex and sets the _resetActiveRowIndex to 0.

member.name: M:ArcGIS.Desktop.Internal.Editing.TableControlCoreViewModel.ResetTable
member.summary: Resets the table (Reinitialized the native table) and calls DelayedRefreshTable. Checks for TestMode and calls RefreshTable Directly
member.remarks:
Logic: - Check to see if the table is not initialized and exits. - (!_isTableInitialized) - CancelActiveTasks - Cancels cancellable tasks, like loading counts. - Updates the schema number - Resets native table - Check to see if the request is valid and exits, if not. - Sets the _sourceUpdating = true; - Makes DelayedRefreshTable or RefreshTableProperties if in TestMode
Class Variable used - _isTableInitialized - Used to cancel work - _schemaId - Increases value - _sourceUpdating - sets to true before refreshing.
Early Exits Table not longer valid, (!_isTableInitialized) Table exception - close table on error and exit.
member.returns: Awaitable Task.

member.name: M:ArcGIS.Desktop.Internal.Editing.TableControlCoreViewModel.RefreshRows
member.summary:
Refreshes the rows of the table.
Logic: - Exit if not ready - !IsValidTableId || !_isTableInitialized || _isTableUnInitializing - Set Busy to true - Get Table counts from native service. - Jump To UI - Update the class count variables (does not fire row collection changes) - Calculates the current row and column indexes. - Reset the current row collection. (fires row collection changes) - Set Busy to False - Dirties the project. - Calls OnFilterCompleted on the table callback.
Class Variable used - IsValidTableId - Check valid state - _isTableInitialized - Check valid state - _isTableUnInitializing - Check valid state - IsWaitingForRowRefresh - Check valid state - _tableCallback - Inform of filter change.
Early Exits - Invalid state - Error - Fires Fatal Error to close the table.
member.returns: Awaitable Task.

member.summary: Is called when the delayed refresh action completes.

member.name: M:ArcGIS.Desktop.Internal.Editing.TableControlCoreViewModel.RefreshTableProperties(System.Boolean)
member.summary:
Refreshes the table. Logic: - If not reconnecting and not on ui and not in test mode, then the call jumps to the UI thread. - Check to see if the request is valid and exits, if not. - (!_isTableInitialized || _tableIsClosingOnError || !_refreshMonitor.CanContinue) - Cancel any edits being done by the table. - Sets the busy flag - if _restablishActiveCellAfterRefresh, call calculate indexes. - CancelActiveTasks - Cancels cancellable tasks, like loading counts. - Resets native table, if _resetTableOnRefresh - Refreshes the table description values, by calling get table info. - Updates the caption - if _sourceUpdating || isReconnecting - Updates the count variable, fire notifications (Not collection changes). - Updates is editable - Check to see if the request is valid and exits, if not. - Call RefreshTablePropertiesUI with new count.
Class Variable used - _isTableInitialized - Used to cancel work - _tableIsClosingOnError - Used to cancel work - _refreshMonitor.CanContinue - Used to cancel work - _resetTableOnRefresh - Calls native service ResetTable - ReInitializes the table making it ready for the next data request - Set in the RefreshTable() and OnFieldDescriptionsChanged - _restablishActiveCellAfterRefresh - Calculate current row and field indexes. - set in EndEditAsync(), ReconnectTable(), DelayedRefreshTable() - Cleared in LoadActiveCellState() - _sourceUpdating - Updates count and is editable
Early Exits Table exception - close table on error and exit. Table not longer valid, (!_isTableInitialized || _tableIsClosingOnError ) A pending table refresh request is encountered or has been cancelled, !_refreshMonitor.CanContinue
member.param: Flag indicating that the table is reconnecting.
member.returns: Awaitable Task.

member.name: M:ArcGIS.Desktop.Internal.Editing.TableControlCoreViewModel.UpdateCount(ArcGIS.Desktop.Editing.TableLoadCountInfo,System.Boolean,System.Nullable{System.Int32},System.Nullable{System.Int32})
member.summary: Updates the count related properties.
member.param: Count information returned from table service.
Update the table descriptions IsCountKnown property.
We should check the max is not reached and if reached we should use this number as the max count.
We should check the max is not reached and if reached we should use this number as the selected max count.
member.returns: The number of rows in the current view of the table.

member.name: T:ArcGIS.Desktop.Editing.Events.TableEditEvent
member.summary: Defines a class that manages publication and subscription to events.

member.name: T:ArcGIS.Desktop.Editing.Events.RowCreatedEvent
member.summary: Occurs when a Row is created.
member.remarks:
The RowCreatedEvent is published during the execution of the edit operation. Any modifications performed within the RowEvent handler can cause cascaded events to be generated. Make sure you have an exit condition to avoid infinite recursion. For example, if you are changing a feature attribute within a RowCreatedEvent or RowChangedEvent, consider tracking that feature's objectID to ignore the corresponding RowChangedEvent your attribute change will generate.
If you need to edit additional tables within the RowEvent you MUST use the ArcGIS.Core.Data API to edit the tables directly. Do NOT use a new edit operation to create or modify features or rows in your RowEvent callback.

member.name: M:ArcGIS.Desktop.Editing.Events.RowCreatedEvent.Subscribe(System.Action{ArcGIS.Desktop.Editing.Events.RowChangedEventArgs},ArcGIS.Core.Data.Table,System.Boolean)
member.summary: Subscribes to RowCreatedEvents that are published when a row is created. This method must be called on the MCT. Use QueuedTask.Run.
member.param: The delegate that gets executed when the event is published.
The table to listen to.
(optional) The type of reference used to maintain the delegate. false is a weak reference, true is a strong reference. (default value = false)
member.returns: A token that uniquely identifies the subscription.
member.exception: This method or property must be called within the lambda passed to QueuedTask.Run.

member.name: M:ArcGIS.Desktop.Editing.Events.RowCreatedEvent.Unsubscribe(ArcGIS.Core.Events.SubscriptionToken)
member.summary: Unsubscribe from RowCreatedEvents. This method must be called on the MCT. Use QueuedTask.Run.
member.param: A subscription token that was returned by Subscribe.

member.name: T:ArcGIS.Desktop.Editing.Events.RowChangedEvent
member.summary: Occurs when a Row is changed.
member.remarks:
The RowChangedEvent is published during the execution of the edit operation. Any modifications performed within the RowEvent handler can cause cascaded events to be generated. Make sure you have an exit condition to avoid infinite recursion. For example, if you are changing a feature attribute within a RowCreatedEvent or RowChangedEvent, consider tracking that feature's objectID to ignore the corresponding RowChangedEvent your attribute change will generate.
If you need to edit additional tables within the RowEvent you MUST use the EditOperation that is passed through the . Do NOT use a new edit operation to create or modify features or rows in your RowEvent callback.

member.name: M:ArcGIS.Desktop.Editing.Events.RowChangedEvent.Subscribe(System.Action{ArcGIS.Desktop.Editing.Events.RowChangedEventArgs},ArcGIS.Core.Data.Table,System.Boolean)
member.summary: Subscribes to RowChangedEvents that are published when a row changes. This method must be called on the MCT. Use QueuedTask.Run.
member.param: A delegate that is executed when a RowChangedEvent is published.
The table to listen to.
(optional) The type of reference used to maintain the delegate. false is a weak reference, true is a strong reference. (default value = false)
member.returns: A token that uniquely identifies the subscription.
member.exception: This method or property must be called within the lambda passed to QueuedTask.Run.

member.name: M:ArcGIS.Desktop.Editing.Events.RowChangedEvent.Unsubscribe(ArcGIS.Core.Events.SubscriptionToken)
member.summary: Unsubscribe from RowChangedEvents. This method must be called on the MCT. Use QueuedTask.Run.
member.param: A subscription token that was returned by Subscribe.

member.name: T:ArcGIS.Desktop.Editing.Events.RowDeletedEvent
member.summary: Occurs when a Row is deleted.
member.remarks:
The RowDeletedEvent is published during the execution of the edit operation. Any modifications performed within the RowEvent handler can cause cascaded events to be generated. Make sure you have an exit condition to avoid infinite recursion. For example, if you are changing a feature attribute within a RowCreatedEvent or RowChangedEvent, consider tracking that feature's objectID to ignore the corresponding RowChangedEvent your attribute change will generate.
If you need to edit additional tables within the RowEvent you MUST use the ArcGIS.Core.Data API to edit the tables directly. Do NOT use a new edit operation to create or modify features or rows in your RowEvent callback.

member.name: T:ArcGIS.Desktop.Editing.Attributes.Domain
member.summary: Represents an abstract base class for a Domain. There are two subclasses RangeDomain and CodedValueDomain.

remarks.para: Attribute domains are rules that describe the legal values of a field type, providing a method for enforcing data integrity. Attribute domains are used to constrain the values allowed in any particular attribute for a table or feature class.

member.name: T:ArcGIS.Desktop.Editing.Attributes.Inspector
member.summary: Provides access to the attribute values on features and rows.

remarks.para:
This class is primarily used to get or set the attribute values on features or rows. Additionally it provides some meta information.
To get or set attribute values, first load a feature or row into the class then use the class properties or attribute index/name.
You can also use the Inspector class to obtain schema information about a mapMember. Use the or methods to obtain schema information.

member.name: T:ArcGIS.Desktop.Editing.InspectorProvider
member.summary: Provides a mechanism to customize attribute behavior within an inspector.
member.remarks: Typically this would be used in conjunction with the method. Override the provided methods to hide attributes, highlight attributes, make attributes non-editable, show custom aliases and provide custom validators within the context of the attribute inspector grid.

member.name: M:ArcGIS.Desktop.Editing.InspectorProvider.SharedFieldColumnSizeID
member.summary: Gets a unique GUID for any inspector created from this provider. Use this to control the width of the first column (field name or alias) across multiple inspector grids. If multiple inspectors use the same GUID, then the inspector grids for each will appear with shared column widths.
member.remarks: Normally the inspector grid sizes the first column width (field name or alias) to be as long as needed to show the longest field name in the inspector. If multiple inspectors use the same GUID, then they are coupled together so that the first column width is as long as needed to show the longest field name of the the combined inspectors.

member.name: M:ArcGIS.Desktop.Editing.InspectorProvider.IgnoreValidation(ArcGIS.Desktop.Mapping.MapMember)
member.summary: Gets if validation is ignored on the Inspector attributes. Default value is false.
member.param: The MapMember currently loaded in the inspector. Can be null.
member.remarks: If this is set to true then no validation is performed on the current set of attributes. Data applied can still fail a post at the geodatabase level.

member.name: T:ArcGIS.Desktop.Editing.EditingStateManager
member.summary: definition of a manager that coordinates de/serialization of EditingModule state within separate state managers that are responsible for some (smaller) portion of state. Individual state managers are constructed in the static constructor of this class - implementations must have a null constructor that is light-weight. They are discovered at run-time by searching for all implementations of IEditingStateManager.

member.name: T:ArcGIS.Desktop.Editing.EditingScrollViewer
member.summary: Same as the default ScrollViewer but uses a custom automation peer. See EditingScrollViewerAutomationPeer

member.name: T:ArcGIS.Desktop.Editing.EditingScrollViewerAutomationPeer
member.summary:
Used currently by the Create and Modify Features panes. This extends ScrollViewerAutomationPeer to ensure that automation peers are created for items below the GroupItems since this does not happen for dynamically created data by default. Removing the GroupItems is done just to clean up the tree.
For CFW/MFW the UI automation tree changes from this: - ScrollViewer - GroupItem - GroupItem
To this: - ScrollViewer - Expander - Item 1 - Item 2 - Expander - Item 3 - Item 4

member.name: P:ArcGIS.Desktop.Editing.HostDialog.NeedGeometryRefresh
member.summary: This was added as part of a workaround to bring the vertices grid back to the split pane. Currently, whenever split calls RefreshMessages(), it will trigger a HotSelectOperationEvent. When this is handled by the HotSelectViewModel, RefreshGeometry() will be called. Since split generates these events so often, this property was added to prevent unnecessary geometry refreshes. Original issue: /editing/issues/1012

member.name: P:ArcGIS.Desktop.Editing.HostDialog.IgnoreToolActivation
member.summary: this is a map-switching hack to allow EditFeatures to prevent tool de/activation within Initialize and Shutdown. Another way to do this would be to add a bool param to those methods, but those methods are used a *lot*, so this approach is simpler - time will tell if it works ok....

member.name: T:ArcGIS.Desktop.Editing.IMapSwitchingListener
member.summary:
define a listener for objects wishing to be considered for map-switching activities. Two differing workflows occur.
If the incoming and outgoing panes are different views of the same map, then only OnMapViewSwitched is called.
Otherwise it is assumed that switching occurs between two different maps, or a Map and a non-map view, and then, If the outgoing pane contains a map view then Save is called first. If the outgoing pane is not null, then CleanUp is called next. If the incoming pane contains a map view then OnMapSwitched is called.

member.name: M:ArcGIS.Desktop.Editing.IMapSwitchingListener.GetID
member.summary: application-wide unique ID - DAML-ID is a good choice if available

member.name: M:ArcGIS.Desktop.Editing.IMapSwitchingListener.Save(ArcGIS.Desktop.Internal.Mapping.MapViewInternal)
member.summary: called when a mapview is switched away from, but not closed, and the incoming view is *not* the same map
member.returns: the state that this listener wishes to save

member.name: M:ArcGIS.Desktop.Editing.IMapSwitchingListener.CleanUp
member.summary: called when a mapview is either switched away from (after Save has been called) or closed (in which case, there isn't a MapView to save)

member.name: M:ArcGIS.Desktop.Editing.IMapSwitchingListener.OnMapViewSwitched(ArcGIS.Desktop.Internal.Mapping.MapViewInternal,ArcGIS.Desktop.Internal.Mapping.MapViewInternal)
member.summary: called when switching between two views of the same map
member.param: an existing view that is being switched away from
either an existing view that is being switched to, or a newly created view

member.summary: called when switching to a view of a map that differs from an outgoing map or non-map; possibly after previous calls to Save and CleanUp
member.param: the newly opened map view
the previously opened map view, or null == previous pane was not a map
the state that was provided by incoming map from a previous

member.name: T:ArcGIS.Desktop.Editing.RowToken
member.summary: A RowToken represents a feature that will be created but has not yet been created. It can be used in place of the object ID in referencing that feature even before it has an Object ID.
member.remarks: The RowToken can be used to chain together multiple editing primitives that depend on each other. For example, you can create two rows using Create(), and use the resulting RowTokens to create a utility network connectivity association.

member.summary: If the first row represents a device with terminals, the terminal on the first row to connect. Otherwise the value is -1.

member.name: P:ArcGIS.Desktop.Editing.AssociationDescription.Terminal2

member.name: P:ArcGIS.Desktop.Editing.AssociationDescription.IsContentVisible
member.summary: Gets a value indicating whether the content in the map is visible when outside of a container view if this Association represents a association. For all other AssociationTypes the value is False.

member.name: P:ArcGIS.Desktop.Editing.AssociationDescription.PercentAlong
member.summary: Gets the percent along the midspan of a non-spatial edge object that a junction or non-spatial junction object is connected to if this Association represents a association. For all other AssocationTypes the value is null.

member.name: M:ArcGIS.Desktop.Editing.AssociationDescription.#ctor(ArcGIS.Core.Data.UtilityNetwork.AssociationType,ArcGIS.Desktop.Editing.RowHandle,ArcGIS.Desktop.Editing.RowHandle)
member.summary:
Creates a new utility network AssociationDescription of the specified type. Use this constructor for
Structural attachment associations ( is ).
Connectivity associations ( is ).
Junction-edge "from side" object connectivity associations ( is ).
Junction-edge "to side" object connectivity associations ( is ).
member.param: The association type.
The first row in the association.
The second row in the association.
member.remarks:
A utility network structural attachment association is defined between a structure row () and an attachment row (). A utility network connectivity association is defined by two junction rows that are not geometrically coincident. A utility network junction-edge "from side" object connectivity association represents a junction or non-spatial junction object () connecting to the "from" side of a non-spatial edge object (). A utility network junction-edge "to side" object connectivity association represents a junction or non-spatial junction object () connecting to the "to" side of a non-spatial edge object ().
If is , the overloaded should be used instead.
If is , the overloaded should be used instead.

The first row in the association.
The second row in the association.
Determines the visibility of the content row in the map when outside of a container view.
member.remarks: A utility network containment association is defined by a container row (), and a content row () which is added to the Container. The property determines if the Content row is visible in the map when outside of a container view.

member.remarks: RelationshipDescription is used to create and delete a relationship bewtween two rows defined by a RelationshipClass. Once defined, use EditOperation.Create to create the relationship and EditOperation.Delete to remove the relationship.

member.name: P:ArcGIS.Desktop.Editing.RelationshipDescription.RelationshipClass
member.summary: Gets the RelationshipClass representing an association between two tables in a geodatabase.

member.name: P:ArcGIS.Desktop.Editing.RelationshipDescription.OriginRow
member.summary: Gets the RowHandle of the row in the origin table.

member.name: P:ArcGIS.Desktop.Editing.RelationshipDescription.DestinationRow
member.summary: Gets the RowHandle of the row in the destination table.

member.name: P:ArcGIS.Desktop.Editing.RelationshipDescription.Attributes
member.summary: Gets the attributes to assign the new row in the attributed relationship table.

member.name: M:ArcGIS.Desktop.Editing.RelationshipDescription.#ctor(ArcGIS.Core.Data.RelationshipClass,ArcGIS.Desktop.Editing.RowHandle,ArcGIS.Desktop.Editing.RowHandle,System.Collections.Generic.IReadOnlyDictionary{System.String,System.Object})
member.summary: Creates a new instance of the RelationshipDescription class.
member.param: The RelationshipClass representing an association between two tables in a geodatabase.
the RowHandle of the row in the origin table.
the RowHandle of the row in the destination table.
(Optional) The attributes to assign the new row in the attributed relationship table.

member.name: T:ArcGIS.Desktop.Editing.ExecuteModeType
member.summary: An enumeration of possible execute mode types. Used in an to control the order of edit function execution.

member.name: F:ArcGIS.Desktop.Editing.ExecuteModeType.Default
member.summary: Edits are grouped together and executed in the default manner regardless of the order they are defined on the .

member.name: F:ArcGIS.Desktop.Editing.ExecuteModeType.Sequential
member.summary: Edits are executed in a sequential manner in the order they are defined on the .

member.name: T:ArcGIS.Desktop.Editing.EditOperation
member.summary: EditOperations are shortlived objects for performing an Edit, they are generally immediately filled with the parameters of the desired edit and executed then they are discarded after the editor executes them...

member.name: M:ArcGIS.Desktop.Editing.EditOperation.SetOnComplete(System.Action)
member.summary: Sets an action that will be called when this operation is done executing.
member.param: The action to take when this operation is done.

member.name: M:ArcGIS.Desktop.Editing.EditOperation.#ctor
member.summary: Constructs a new EditOperation representing an edit to be performed against the Geodatabase.

member.name: M:ArcGIS.Desktop.Editing.EditOperation.Finalize
member.summary: Finalizer for EditOperation.

member.name: M:ArcGIS.Desktop.Editing.EditOperation.CreateChainedOperation
member.summary: Creates a follow-on operation which will be shared with this operation on the application's undo stack.
member.remarks: Call CreateChainedOperation once the parent edit operation is known to have executed successfully.
member.returns: A newly created EditOperation that will be merged with this one.

member.name: M:ArcGIS.Desktop.Editing.EditOperation.GetAwaiter
member.summary: This method is intended for compiler use rather than for use in application code. The presence of this method allows an EditOperation to be 'await'-ed like a Task (the Task returned by calling ExecuteAsync()).

member.name: P:ArcGIS.Desktop.Editing.EditOperation.EditOperationType
member.summary: Gets and sets the transaction type for the EditOperation.
member.value: Type: A nullable type determining the transaction type. The default value is null.

member.name: M:ArcGIS.Desktop.Editing.EditOperation.SetOnUndone(System.Action)
member.summary: Sets an action that will be called when this operation is undone.
member.param: The action to take when this operation is undone.

member.name: M:ArcGIS.Desktop.Editing.EditOperation.SetOnRedone(System.Action)
member.summary: Sets an action that will be called when this editoperation is redone.
member.param: The action to take when this operation is redone.

member.name: M:ArcGIS.Desktop.Editing.EditOperation.SetOnComitted(System.Action{System.Boolean})
member.summary: Sets an action that will be called when this editoperation is committed.
member.param: The action to take when this operation is committed, the argument specifies whether the edit was saved or discarded.

member.name: M:ArcGIS.Desktop.Editing.EditOperation.UndoAsync
member.summary: Attempts to Undo this EditOperation (only the most recent edit operation can be undone).
member.returns: A task representing the success of the Undo.

member.name: M:ArcGIS.Desktop.Editing.EditOperation.RedoAsync
member.summary: Attempts to Redo this EditOperation (only the most recently undone edit operation can be redone).
member.returns: A task representing the success of the redo.

member.name: P:ArcGIS.Desktop.Editing.EditOperation.IsDone
member.summary: Gets a value indicating if the EditOperation is Done. EditOperations are marked as Done when someone calls ExecuteAsync() on them (even before they are complete).

member.name: P:ArcGIS.Desktop.Editing.EditOperation.IsSucceeded
member.summary: Gets a value indicating if the EditOperation Succeeded. EditOperations are marked as Succeeded when ExecuteAsync() succeeds (the Task terminates with true).

member.name: P:ArcGIS.Desktop.Editing.EditOperation.IsCanceled
member.summary: Gets a value indicating if the EditOperation has been Canceled. EditOperations are marked as Canceled when they have been Executed but canceled before completing and not performed.

member.name: P:ArcGIS.Desktop.Editing.EditOperation.EventToken
member.summary: Provides a way for calling code to identify a particular EditOperation within a subsequent EditEvent. Setting an EventToken in an EditOperation is optional - by default it is null. If set to a non-null object, the EditOperation is subsequently successful, and, an EditEvent is published, then the EventToken object set here, will be available from the corresponding .

member.name: P:ArcGIS.Desktop.Editing.EditOperation.ShowProgressor
member.summary: Gets and sets whether to show a progressor during an EditOperation.

member.name: P:ArcGIS.Desktop.Editing.EditOperation.ExecuteMode
member.summary: Gets and sets the execute mode for the operation. Default value is .

member.name: P:ArcGIS.Desktop.Editing.EditOperation.Name
member.summary: Gets and sets the string reported to the application's undo stack for this EditOperation.

member.name: P:ArcGIS.Desktop.Editing.EditOperation.ProgressMessage
member.summary: Gets and sets the string to show while executing this operation.

member.name: P:ArcGIS.Desktop.Editing.EditOperation.CancelMessage
member.summary: Gets and sets the cancel message.
member.remarks: This is set by EditOperations if is it canceled before completion.

member.name: P:ArcGIS.Desktop.Editing.EditOperation.ErrorMessage
member.summary: Gets and sets the ErrorMessage.
member.remarks: If an EditOperation fails, the ErrorMessage is set with the error, if known.

member.name: P:ArcGIS.Desktop.Editing.EditOperation.IsEmpty
member.summary: Gets a value indicating if the EditOperation is empty.
member.remarks: This is used internally before executing the operation to test if any methods have been set.
member.value: true if the EditOperation has no methods set before executing.

member.name: P:ArcGIS.Desktop.Editing.EditOperation.ShowModalMessageAfterFailure
member.summary: Gets and sets a value to show a modal dialog if the EditOperation fails.
member.remarks: If this property is true a modal error dialog will be shown after the edit fails showing a default UI explaining the failure to the user.

member.name: M:ArcGIS.Desktop.Editing.EditOperation.ConstructPolygons(ArcGIS.Desktop.Editing.Templates.EditingTemplate,ArcGIS.Desktop.Mapping.Layer,System.Collections.Generic.IEnumerable{System.Int64},System.Nullable{System.Double},ArcGIS.Core.Geometry.LinearUnit,System.Boolean)

member.exception: Template and layer cannot be null.

member.name: M:ArcGIS.Desktop.Editing.EditOperation.ExecuteAsync
member.summary: Executes the Edit, modifying the database using the instructions given to the EditOperation. Returns true upon success and false upon failure.
member.returns: A task representing the editoperation that will result in a success or failure.
member.remarks: An EditOperation will fail execution if it detects that there are no edits that produce database changes. This can include a Modify edit that doesn't change any field values. Prior to calling ExecuteAsync you should check the to determine if there is work to be done.

member.name: M:ArcGIS.Desktop.Editing.EditOperation.Execute

member.remarks: An EditOperation will fail execution if it detects that there are no edits that produce database changes. This can include a Modify edit that doesn't change any field values. Prior to calling Execute you should check the to determine if there is work to be done.

member.name: M:ArcGIS.Desktop.Editing.ElevationCapturing.SetCaptureModeAsync(ArcGIS.Desktop.Editing.ElevationCaptureMode)
member.summary: Sets the mode for capturing elevation.

remarks.para: The mode cannot be set to if there are currently no usable elevation surface layers. An attempt to do so will be ignored - calling code should check the afterward, to determine if a change was actually made, or check the value of prior.
An elevation surface layer is considered usable if it is visible and has at least one elevation source layer.
If successful, the new capture mode will be committed to the currently edited map.

member.exception: if there is no currently edited map
member.returns: A collection of , empty if there are no elevation surface layers in the currently edited map

member.summary: For http://qamonitor/qacommon/CrLookup.aspx?cr=315440, the SketchMayHaveFinishedPeremptorily method of needs to tell the current SketchTool (if it is indeed one) that a MapUpdate event has caused an unstarted Sketch to complete without sending an event - SketchTool code, however, "believes" the sketch is currently in operation. member.name: T:ArcGIS.Desktop.Editing.GroundToGridCorrection
member.summary: Provides helper and extension methods for accessing and setting ground to grid corrections.

member.name: P:ArcGIS.Desktop.Editing.GroundToGridCorrection.CombinedScaleFactorForSketch
member.summary: Gets the combined scale factor when sketching within the currently active map.
member.remarks: Subscribe to to be notified when the combined scale factor is changed during the current sketch.

member.name: P:ArcGIS.Desktop.Editing.GroundToGridCorrection.Enabled
member.summary: Gets if ground to grid corrections are enabled for supported tools.
member.remarks: Subscribe to to be notified when the Enabled property is changed during the current sketch.

member.name: P:ArcGIS.Desktop.Editing.GroundToGridCorrection.UseDirection
member.summary: Gets if the direction offset will be used when ground to grid corrections apply within the currently active map.
member.remarks: Subscribe to to be notified when the UseDirection property is changed during the current sketch.

member.name: P:ArcGIS.Desktop.Editing.GroundToGridCorrection.UseScale
member.summary: Gets if the distance scale will be used when ground to grid corrections apply within the currently active map.
member.remarks: Subscribe to to be notified when the UseScale property is changed during the current sketch.

member.name: P:ArcGIS.Desktop.Editing.GroundToGridCorrection.Direction
member.summary: Gets the direction offset angle in degrees that is used in ground to grid calculations.
member.remarks: Subscribe to to be notified when the Direction property is changed during the current sketch.

member.name: P:ArcGIS.Desktop.Editing.GroundToGridCorrection.ScaleType
member.summary: Gets the type of scale that is used in ground to grid calculations.
member.remarks: Subscribe to to be notified when the ScaleType property is changed during the current sketch.

member.name: P:ArcGIS.Desktop.Editing.GroundToGridCorrection.ConstantScaleFactor
member.summary: Gets the constant scale factor used in ground to grid calculations, when equals
member.remarks: Subscribe to to be notified when the ConstantScaleFactor property is changed during the current sketch.

member.name: M:ArcGIS.Desktop.Editing.GroundToGridCorrection.GetGroundToGridCorrection(ArcGIS.Desktop.Mapping.Map)
member.summary: Gets the GroundToGridCorrection for the given map.
member.remarks: This extension method of the class will automatically switch to the correct thread for the result.
member.param: The that has the required GroundToGridCorrection.
member.returns: A Task returning a for the given map, or null if there is currently none.
member.exception: map is null.

member.name: M:ArcGIS.Desktop.Editing.GroundToGridCorrection.SetGroundToGridCorrection(ArcGIS.Desktop.Mapping.Map,ArcGIS.Core.CIM.CIMGroundToGridCorrection)
member.summary: Sets the GroundToGridCorrection for the given map.
member.remarks: This extension method for the class automatically switches to the correct thread to set the property. The map will not refresh after making the change. Calling code can listen to to be notified when a change is completed. An event is published when the new correction differs from the existing correction.
member.param: The that will have its GroundToGridCorrection set.
The that will be set.
member.returns: A Task returning true when a change has been made, and false when no change has been made.
member.exception: map is null or correction is null.

member.name: M:ArcGIS.Desktop.Editing.GroundToGridCorrection.ComputeCombinedScaleFactor(ArcGIS.Desktop.Mapping.Map,System.Double,System.Double,System.Double,System.Double,System.Double)
member.summary: Compute the combined scale factor using two points and using a z elevation at the mid-point between them.
member.remarks: This extension method for the class requires a map in a projected coordinate system, and assumes the x,y coordinates are in the map's and the z coordinate is in the map's . If the map has no ZUnit then the same unit for x,y is used for the z coordinate.
member.param: The map used to calculate the combined scale factor.
The x coordinate of the first point.
The y coordinate of the first point.
The x coordinate of the second point.
The y coordinate of the second point.
The z coordinate.
member.returns: A Task returning the calculated combined scale factor.
member.exception: map is null.

member.name: M:ArcGIS.Desktop.Editing.GroundToGridCorrection.IsCorrecting(ArcGIS.Core.CIM.CIMGroundToGridCorrection)
member.summary: Gets whether the ground to grid correction is turned on or off.
member.remarks: This extension method for the class is identical to: c != null && c.Enabled
member.param: A obtained from
member.returns: true when c is not null and c is enabled, false otherwise.

member.name: M:ArcGIS.Desktop.Editing.GroundToGridCorrection.UsingDirectionOffset(ArcGIS.Core.CIM.CIMGroundToGridCorrection)
member.summary: Gets whether the direction offset will be used in the ground to grid correction.
member.remarks: This extension method for the class is identical to: c.IsCorrecting() && c.UseDirection
member.param: A obtained from
member.returns: true when c is not null, when c is enabled, and when the UseDirection property is true; false otherwise.

member.name: M:ArcGIS.Desktop.Editing.GroundToGridCorrection.UsingDistanceFactor(ArcGIS.Core.CIM.CIMGroundToGridCorrection)
member.summary: Gets whether a distance factor will be used in the ground to grid correction.
member.remarks: This extension method for the class is identical to: c.IsCorrecting() && c.UseScale
member.param: A obtained from
member.returns: true when c is not null, when c is enabled, and when the UseScale property is true; false otherwise.

member.name: M:ArcGIS.Desktop.Editing.GroundToGridCorrection.UsingConstantScaleFactor(ArcGIS.Core.CIM.CIMGroundToGridCorrection)
member.summary: Gets whether a constant scale factor will be used in the ground to grid correction.
member.remarks: This extension method for the class is identical to: c.UsingScaleFactor() && c.ScaleType == GroundToGridScaleType.ConstantFactor
member.param: A obtained from
member.returns: true when c is not null, when c is enabled, and when the ScaleType property is ; false otherwise.

member.name: M:ArcGIS.Desktop.Editing.GroundToGridCorrection.UsingElevationMode(ArcGIS.Core.CIM.CIMGroundToGridCorrection)
member.summary: Gets whether a combined scale factor will be used in the ground to grid correction.
member.remarks: This extension method for the class is identical to: c.UsingScaleFactor() && c.ScaleType == GroundToGridScaleType.ComputeUsingElevation
member.param: A obtained from
member.returns: true when c is not null, when c is enabled, and when the ScaleType property is ; false otherwise.

member.name: M:ArcGIS.Desktop.Editing.GroundToGridCorrection.GetConstantScaleFactor(ArcGIS.Core.CIM.CIMGroundToGridCorrection)
member.summary: Gets the constant scale factor to be used in ground to grid calculations.
member.remarks: This extension method for the class is identical to: c.UsingScaleFactor() ? c.ConstantScaleFactor : DefaultConstantScaleFactor This method can be used whether or not is true and returns the default if false.
member.param: A obtained from
member.returns: The ConstantScaleFactor if UsingConstantScaleFactor is true, otherwise if false.

member.name: M:ArcGIS.Desktop.Editing.GroundToGridCorrection.GetDirectionOffset(ArcGIS.Core.CIM.CIMGroundToGridCorrection)
member.summary: Gets the angle in decimal degrees to be used in ground to grid calculations.

member.name: T:ArcGIS.Desktop.Editing.ParallelOffset
member.summary: Defines the parameters used to create a parallel offset from line features.
member.remarks: To use ParallelOffset in EditOperation.Create, instantiate a ParallelOffset.Builder, set the parameters then call to return a ParallelOffset.

member.name: T:ArcGIS.Desktop.Editing.ParallelOffset.Builder
member.summary: Defines the parameters used to create a parallel offset from line features.

member.name: M:ArcGIS.Desktop.Editing.ParallelOffset.Builder.#ctor
member.summary: Initializes an empty instance of the class.

member.name: P:ArcGIS.Desktop.Editing.ParallelOffset.Builder.Selection
member.summary: Gets and sets the lines to be copied from.
member.remarks: If non line features are in the selection, the copy will fail.

member.name: P:ArcGIS.Desktop.Editing.ParallelOffset.Builder.Template
member.summary: Gets and sets the template to create the copies in.
member.remarks: If a template is not specified, the copy will fail.

member.name: P:ArcGIS.Desktop.Editing.ParallelOffset.Builder.Distance
member.summary: Gets and sets the offset distance in map units. (Default value = 0)

member.name: P:ArcGIS.Desktop.Editing.ParallelOffset.Builder.Side
member.summary: Gets and sets on which side of selected lines the offset lines will be copied. (Default value = ParallelOffset.SideType.Both)

member.name: P:ArcGIS.Desktop.Editing.ParallelOffset.Builder.Corner
member.summary: Gets and sets the shape of corners created in the copied lines. (Default value = ParallelOffset.CornerType.Mitered)

member.name: P:ArcGIS.Desktop.Editing.ParallelOffset.Builder.Iterations
member.summary: Gets and sets the number of parallel offset copies to create. (Default value = 1)
member.remarks: The copies are created sequentially by the offset distance. For example, copying a line to one side specifying a distance of 5 and 2 iterations will create one line at 5 and one at 10 from the original line, not two lines at 5.

member.name: P:ArcGIS.Desktop.Editing.ParallelOffset.Builder.AlignConnected
member.summary: Gets and sets If two or more connected lines should have their direction temporarily aligned for the purposes of the copy. (Default value = false)
member.remarks:
Use this setting to temporarily align the direction of connected lines in the selection to ensure the output features are created on a consistent side. The direction is random.
This setting has no effect on disconnected lines.

member.name: P:ArcGIS.Desktop.Editing.ParallelOffset.Builder.CopyToSeparateFeatures
member.summary: Gets and sets if connected lines should be copied to separate lines. (Default value = false).
member.remarks:
This setting is only used if AlignConnected is true.
When set to true, this setting creates a separate line for each connected line in the selection, otherwise a single line is created.

member.name: P:ArcGIS.Desktop.Editing.ParallelOffset.Builder.RemoveSelfIntersectingLoops
member.summary: Gets and sets if self intersecting loops should be removed in the copied features. (Default value = True)
member.remarks: If AlignConnected and CopyToSeparateFeatures are True, this setting is required to be True else the edit operation will fail.

member.name: M:ArcGIS.Desktop.Editing.ParallelOffset.Builder.Build
member.summary: Creates a ParallelOffset from the current ParallelOffset.Builder, for use in EditOperation.Create
member.returns: A ParallelOffset

member.name: M:ArcGIS.Desktop.Editing.ParallelOffset.ToBuilder
member.summary: Returns a ParallelOffset.Builder from the current ParallelOffset.
member.returns: A ParallelOffset.Builder

member.name: M:ArcGIS.Desktop.Editing.ParallelOffset.Create(ArcGIS.Desktop.Editing.ParallelOffset.Builder)
member.summary: A class representing the parameters for copying parallel line features.

member.summary: Gets the lines to be copied from.
member.remarks: If no line features are in the selection, the copy will fail.

member.summary: Gets the template to create the copies in.
member.remarks: If a template is not specified, the copy will fail.

member.summary: Sets the specified fields to be frozen in the table control. Frozen fields are promoted to be the first visible fields in the table control and stay visible as the table control is scrolled horizontally. member.name: M:ArcGIS.Desktop.Editing.TableTemplateColumn.OnEscapeNavigateFromEditRow(System.Windows.FrameworkElement)

member.name: M:ArcGIS.Desktop.Editing.TableExtensions.ToReadableColor(ArcGIS.Core.CIM.CIMRGBColor)
member.summary:
Creates a readable color for the provided background color.
Uses WCAG rules for a 4.5 contrast ratio between the two colors. - The contrast ratio of TableConstants.WCAGContrastdRatio(4.5:1) was chosen for level AA
member.param: The background color that will display the text.
member.returns: The provide foreground color or a calculated color the meets the WCAG rule.

member.name: M:ArcGIS.Desktop.Editing.TableExtensions.ToReadableHyperlinkColor(ArcGIS.Core.CIM.CIMRGBColor,System.Boolean)
member.summary:
Creates a readable hyperlink color for the provided background color.
Uses WCAG rules for a 4.5 contrast ratio between the two colors. - The contrast ratio of TableConstants.WCAGContrastdRatio(4.5:1) was chosen for level AA
member.param: The background color that will display the text.
The text is for hover.
member.returns: The provide foreground color or a calculated color the meets the WCAG rule.

member.name: M:ArcGIS.Desktop.Editing.TableExtensions.GetLuminance(System.Windows.Media.Color)
member.summary: Calculate the Luminance for a color.
member.remarks:
This uses the relative luminance formula from https://www.w3.org/TR/WCAG20/#relativeluminancedef
Luminance = 0.2126 * r + 0.7152 * g + 0.0722 * b Where: r = (color.R/255)^2.2 g = (color.G/255)^2.2 b = (color.B/255)^2.2
member.param: The color.
member.returns: The luminance for the color in the range of 0 to 1.

member.name: M:ArcGIS.Desktop.Editing.TableResources.InitializeHyperlinkColors
member.summary:
Create the color array to find readable foregrounds for hyperlink text and hover text to be used over rows with custom selection and highlight colors.
It uses the ProFlexGridHyperlinkLightBrushKey, ProFlexGridHyperlinkDarkBrushKey, Esri_TextCaptionActiveBrush brushes to create the color ramp arrays.

member.name: M:ArcGIS.Desktop.Editing.TableResources.CreateGrayScaleColor(System.Byte)
member.summary: Creates a gray scalo color for an RGB value.
member.param: The R, G and B value.
member.returns: The gray scale color.

member.name: M:ArcGIS.Desktop.Editing.TableResources.GetColorContrastRatio(System.Double,System.Double)
member.summary:
Calculates the contrast ratio between two colors given their luminance's.
It uses the following formula: (L1 + 0.05) / (L2 + 0.05), where L1 is the relative luminance of the lighter of the colors, and L2 is the relative luminance of the darker of the colors.
Contrast Ration under Key Terms https://www.w3.org/TR/UNDERSTANDING-WCAG20/visual-audio-contrast-contrast.html
member.param: The luminance of the first color.
The luminance of the second color.
member.returns: The contrast ratio in the range of 1 to 21

member.name: T:ArcGIS.Desktop.Editing.TableOptions
member.summary: Class manages the table options

member.name: P:ArcGIS.Desktop.Editing.TableOptions.DisableAddRow
member.summary:
Adding new rows for feature classes is disabled for tables
This is controlled by the TableAdministratorSettings.DisableAddRow property. When the Administrator Settings is not available, the Settings.Default.TableOptionsDisableAddRow is used.
Note that the Framework does this check for us in the Settings.Default.TableOptionsDisableAddRow getter.

member.name: P:ArcGIS.Desktop.Editing.TableOptions.IsDisableAddRowLocked
member.summary:
Gets and sets IsDisableAddRowEnabled which is used for disabling the checkbox.
This is controlled by the Administrator setting TableAdministratorSettings.DisableAddRow.IsLocked == false or not present.

member.name: P:ArcGIS.Desktop.Editing.TableOptions.UriSchemesSupportedLockedByAdmin
member.summary: Gets UriSchemesSupportedLockedByAdmin property by reading the TableAdministratorSettings.AllowWebLinks.IsLocked.

member.name: P:ArcGIS.Desktop.Editing.TableOptions.AreUriSchemesSupported
member.summary:
Gets or sets a value indicating that Web Uris are supported as hyperlinks in the table.
Uses the TableAdministratorSettings.AllowWebLinks or the Settings.Default.TableOptionsUriSchemesSupported property to determine the value.
If the UriSchemesSupportedLockedByAdmin == true and the list of schemes is empty, this is deemed to be false. No need for the table to do work to maintain hyperlinks.

member.name: P:ArcGIS.Desktop.Editing.TableOptions.UriSchemesListLockedByAdmin
member.summary: Gets UriSchemesListLockedByAdmin property by reading the TableAdministratorSettings.AllowWebLinks.IsLocked.

member.name: P:ArcGIS.Desktop.Editing.TableOptions.UriSchemesList
member.summary:
Gets or sets the list of allowed web schemes.
It uses the TableAdministratorSettings.SupportedUriSchemeList or the Settings.Default.TableOptionsUriSchemes property to determine the value.

member.name: P:ArcGIS.Desktop.Editing.TableOptions.UriFilesSupportedLockedByAdmin
member.summary: Gets UriFilesSupportedLockedByAdmin property by reading the TableAdministratorSettings.AllowFileLinks.IsLocked property.

member.name: P:ArcGIS.Desktop.Editing.TableOptions.AreUriFilesSupported
member.summary:
Gets or sets a value indicating that File Uris are supported as hyperlinks in the table.
Uses the TableAdministratorSettings.AllowFileLinks or the Settings.Default.TableOptionsUriFilesSupported property to determine the value.
If the UriFilesSupportedLockedByAdmin == true and the list of file extensions is empty, this is deemed to be false. No need for the table to do work to maintain hyperlinks.

member.name: P:ArcGIS.Desktop.Editing.TableOptions.UriFilesListLockedByAdmin
member.summary: Gets UriFilesListLockedByAdmin property by reading the TableAdministratorSettings.AllowFileLinks.IsLocked or TableAdministratorSettings.SupportedFileExtensionList.IsLocked property.

member.name: P:ArcGIS.Desktop.Editing.TableOptions.UriFilesList
member.summary:
Gets or sets the list of allowed file extensions.
It uses the TableAdministratorSettings.SupportedFileExtensionList or the Settings.Default.TableOptionsUriFiles property to determine the value.

member.name: F:ArcGIS.Desktop.Editing.TableOptions.MaxRowsDefaultUnknownCount
member.summary: The initial count of rows, when the table's max row exceeds MaxRows.

member.name: P:ArcGIS.Desktop.Editing.TableOptions.HonorSelectionColor
member.summary: Gets or sets the HonorSelectionColor property.

member.name: M:ArcGIS.Desktop.Editing.TableOptions.GetSafeSetting``1(System.Func{``0},``0,System.Boolean)
member.summary:
Settings that hold value types and have no DEFAULT values, will throw cast exceptions.
This is done to allow user to work with Pro admin settings to set a default value for a setting, but not lock it. It allows the user to set the value back to what table uses as a default value.
member.param: The callback to query for the setting.
The fault value for the setting.
For reference types that are null, the defaultValue will be used as the value of the setting.

member.name: T:ArcGIS.Desktop.Editing.Templates.EditingGroupTemplate
member.summary: Defines a grouping of existing s that can be used to create multiple features together.

remarks.para: This implementation of defines a grouping of one or more existing EditingRowTemplates, whose definable properties include the same properties as feature templates, together with properties that set the primary template and tool category, additional templates, and builders. Each EditingRowTemplate is stored within a Part along with the corresponding BuilderMethod.

You create features or temporary geometry with the primary template. The other templates in the group are assigned builders that autogenerate additional features based on the geometry of the feature or features you create in the map. For example, if you assign a water main template as the primary template, you create the water mains in the map, and other templates such as fittings, gate valves, and hydrants can be configured to autogenerate these features at locations based on the geometry of the water main.
Note: an EditingGroupTemplate cannot be added to another EditingGroupTemplate.

member.name: T:ArcGIS.Desktop.Editing.Templates.GroupTemplateBuilderMethods
member.summary: Enumeration for gropu template builder methods. Used in

member.name: F:ArcGIS.Desktop.Editing.Templates.GroupTemplateBuilderMethods.builderPointIdentity
member.summary: Multiple point features builder. Available for use with a base template of geometry type point and a component template of geometry type point. Creates a point feature in the component template layer with the same geometry as the base point feature.
member.remarks: There are no option parameters required.

member.name: F:ArcGIS.Desktop.Editing.Templates.GroupTemplateBuilderMethods.builderPointAtEndOfLine
member.summary: Point at end of line builder. Available for use with a base template of geometry type polyline and a component template of geometry type point. Creates a point feature in the component template layer offset with the specified attributes from the end vertex of the base polyline feature. If no parameters are specified, a point feature in the component template layer is created at the end vertex of the base polyline feature.
member.remarks:
Option parameters are required. The keys are
distanceValue (in meters)
proportional (between 0 and 100 inclusive)
isProportional (0 = No, 1 = Yes)
offsetDistance (in meters)
side (0 = None, 1 = Left, 2 = Right)
vertexBeforeOffset (default = true)

member.name: F:ArcGIS.Desktop.Editing.Templates.GroupTemplateBuilderMethods.builderPointAtBeginningOfLine
member.summary: Point at beginning of line builder. Available for use with a base template of geometry type polyline and a component template of geometry type point. Creates a point feature in the component template layer offset with the specified attributes from the beginning vertex of the base polyline feature. If no parameters are specified, a point feature in the component template layer is created at the beginning vertex of the base polyline feature.
member.remarks:
Option parameters are required. The keys are
distanceValue (in meters)
proportional (between 0 and 100 inclusive)
isProportional (0 = No, 1 = Yes)
offsetDistance (in meters)
side (0 = None, 1 = Left, 2 = Right)
vertexBeforeOffset (default = true)

member.summary: this hack allows MultiPatch to delay activating a tool until a model has been selected

member.name: P:ArcGIS.Desktop.Editing.Templates.EditingTemplate.CanBeGroupTemplatePart
member.summary: Gets whether this EditingTemplate can be included as part of a GroupTemplate.
member.remarks:
The current rules for including an EditingTemplate in an are:
the associated Layer must be of a type that is supported for feature editing,
templates for MultiPatch or MultiPoint feature Layers may not be included, and
a GroupTemplate may not be included in another GroupTemplate

member.name: M:ArcGIS.Desktop.Editing.TopologySubtractFeaturesCommand.OnClickAsync_Test(System.Tuple{System.Boolean,System.Boolean,ArcGIS.Desktop.Editing.esriTopologySelectedFeature})
member.summary:
This is used for MVVM testing. The predefined selection is applied to all errors:
The predefined selection must be specified as follows.
Tuple{bool Fix/Skip, bool multiple/single, selection)} selection can be esriTopologySelectedFeature.originFeature or esriTopologySelectedFeature.destinationFeature
{true, true, selection} => Apply selection to all remaining fixes {true, false, selection} => Apply selection to next fix only {false, true, selection} => Skip all remaining fixes {false, false, selection} => Skip the next fix only

member.name: T:ArcGIS.Desktop.Mapping.Events.BeforeSketchCompletedEvent
member.summary: Occurs before a sketch is completed.
member.remarks:
You can to listen for the BeforeSketchCompletedEvent and specify a delegate that will be executed upon receiving the event. To stop listening, you can Unsubscribe.
The following are examples of tools that publish the sketch events - construction tools, Edit Vertices, Align Features, Reshape.
The BeforeSketchCompletedEvent fires when a sketch is finished but before the SketchCompletedEvent and MapTool.OnSketchCompleteAsync. This event can be used to read the current sketch geometry and update it via the BeforeSketchCompletedEventArgs.SetSketchGeometry method. If there are multiple listeners to the event, each gets the latest modified sketch geometry from the previous listener.

Gets the item source of the table view. Use and to retrieve the data.

Gets the ObjectID of the active row in the table.
The value of the row can be null, when the table does not have object ids, the active row is the new row, or the data for the row has not been loaded.

member.summary: Sets the specified fields to be frozen in the table view. Frozen fields are promoted to be the first visible fields in the table view and stay visible as the table view is scrolled horizontally. A divider bar is placed between the frozen fields and the remaining fields in the table. The specified list of fields are added to any existing fields that are already frozen.

member.summary: Gets the set of frozen fields in the table view.
